hospitalAcquiredConditions: Central Line-Associated Blood Stream Infections CLABSI
criticalMetrics: Acute Myocardial Infarction 30 Day Raw Mortality

taskList.title: Ensure preoperative skin antisepsis, such as basic soap and water shower; use chlorhexidine gluconate showers
taskList.description: Develop standardized perioperative skin antiseptic practices utilizing the most appropriate skin antiseptic for the type of surgery performed

taskList.title: Establish system so surgical site infection data is analyzed and shared
taskList.description: Develop a protocol to provide guidance on blood transfusion practices, as a unit of packed red blood cells should be considered a transplant/immune modulator and has been linked to a higher risk of SSIs

taskList.title: Send discharge summary and after-hospital care plan to primary care provider within 24 to 48 hours of discharge
taskList.description: Conduct post-discharge follow-up calls within 48 hours of discharge; reinforce components of afterhospital care plan using teach-back and identify any unmet needs, such as access to medication, transportation to follow-up appointments, etc.

taskList.title: Identify primary caregiver, if not the patient, and include him/her in education and discharge planning
taskList.description: Provide patient education that is culturally sensitive, incorporates health literacy concepts and includes information on diagnosis and symptom management, medications and post-discharge care needs

taskList.title: Perform accurate medication reconciliation at admission, at any change in level of care and at discharge
taskList.description: The report also shows that consumers will not easily forgive a company once a breach exposing their personal data occurs.

taskList.title: Conduct formal risk of readmission assessment. Align interventions to patient‚Äôs needs and risk stratification level
taskList.description: Conduct enhanced admission assessment of discharge needs and begin discharge planning at admission

taskList.title: Use breathable glide sheets and/or lifting devices to prevent shear and friction
taskList.description: Cover operating room tables with special overlay mattresses for long cases (greater than 4 hours some hospitals choose cases greater than 2 hours) and high-risk patients.

taskList.title: Monitor weight, nutrition and hydration status; for high-risk patients, generate an automatic registered dietician consult.
taskList.description: Set specific time frames or create reminder systems to reposition patient, such as hourly or every- two-hours rounding with a purpose (the 3 P‚Äôs: pain, potty, position-pressure). This aligns nicely with fall prevention

taskList.title: Assess skin and risk at least daily and incorporate into other routine assessments
taskList.description: Implement head-to-toe skin evaluation and risk assessment tool; assess the skin and risks within 4 hours of admission; risk and skin assessment should be age appropriate

taskList.title: Review medications (by pharmacist); avoid unnecessary hypnotics, sedatives
taskList.description: Include patients, families and caregivers in efforts to prevent falls. Educate regarding fall prevention measures; stay with patient

taskList.title: Reassess risk with changes in patient condition
taskList.description: Round every 1 to 2 hours for high-risk patients address needs (e.g., 3Ps: pain, potty,position-pressure). Combine with other tasks (vital signs)

taskList.title: Use 2% chlorhexidine-impregnated cloths for daily skin cleansing
taskList.description: Do not routinely replace CVCs, PICCs, hemodialysis catheters or pulmonary artery catheters
